definition[0]: very – used to emphasize a bad or harmful quality that someone or something has
example[1]: As a teenager, I was painfully shy.
example[2]: The road to peace is a painfully slow process.
example[3]: We are only too painfully aware of the damage his actions have caused.
example[4]: It was painfully obvious he’d rather not see her again.
example[6]: all the knowledge that he had so painfully acquired
